snippet: A new breed of condominium investor — who buys a second apartment in their own building to become an owner/resident/landlord — has emerged.
abstract: New breed of condominium investor is emerging in New York City, where some owners are buying second and even third apartments in the buildings in which they live as rental units, motivated by low mortgage rates and record-breaking rents. Photos (M)/
lead_paragraph: FOR as long as there have been condominiums, there have been investors hoping to make an easy profit off an apartment here or there. That was certainly the case when the market was booming and buyers -- experienced and otherwise -- snatched up apartments and quickly flipped them for big returns. They were often invisible owners.
